question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned the language through speaking a lot in class and with the professor which was more constructive than textbook learning. His methods of teaching made it easier to learn the language compared to my previous experiences with learning new languages. Three things I learned about was the similarities to French, the construction of sentences and grammar, and that the pronunciation of words/letters are complete (you pronounce every letter unlike in English)

question_text: What knowledge, methods, skills, insights, or ways of thinking did you develop in this course? Please describe three specific things you learned.
response_text: I learned about gardening, I learned how to count, and I learned colors in Creole.

question_text: Reflecting on the overall learning environment of this class, in what ways did the instructor(s) and the structure or components of the course facilitate your learning? Are there specific course components or methods of instruction you’d keep for future years?
response_text: I think the way he starts each class is beneficial to the learning because it’s simply conversing but with sentences you would use daily and it instills the language in our heads. This more than anything has helped me learn.
